summary: To have their drugs covered under Medicaid, the "340B" program requires drug manufacturers to sell outpatient drugs to covered entities—certain hospitals and clinics—at a discount. These entities are increasingly contracting with pharmacies to dispense 340B drugs. Doing so can make it harder to ensure compliance with 340B rules. title: Drug Discount Program: Federal Oversight of Compliance at 340B Contract Pharmacies Needs Improvement
